recipeIngredient: 4 cups  or more ((550+ gms) bread flour or unbleached white flour)
1/4 cup (60 ml) organic canola, safflower or coconut oil
3/4 cup (6.5 oz) plain non dairy yogurt, unsweetened or lightly sweetened, at room temperature for plain naan,
1 to 2 Tbsp canola or coconut oil for cooking

itemListElement.text: In a large mixing bowl, pour warm water and stir in the sugar. Sprinkle yeast on the water and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.
itemListElement.name: In a large mixing bowl, pour warm water and stir in the sugar. Sprinkle yeast on the water and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.

itemListElement.text: In another bowl, combine, the flour with salt, baking powder and baking soda.
itemListElement.name: In another bowl, combine, the flour with salt, baking powder and baking soda.

itemListElement.text: Add 3 cups of the flour mixture, 3 Tbsp oil and 3/4 cup yogurt to the yeast bowl. Mix well to combine. Add more flour a few Tablespoons at a time to make a soft lightly sticky dough. Knead in the bowl or on a floured surface for 2 mins. The dough will get stickier if you knead too long.. (For Avocado Naan, start with 3 cups of flour. If your avocado was not ripe or moist enough, you might need some water while kneading.).
itemListElement.name: Add 3 cups of the flour mixture, 3 Tbsp oil and 3/4 cup yogurt to the yeast bowl. Mix well to combine. Add more flour a few Tablespoons at a time to make a soft lightly sticky dough. Knead in the bowl or on a floured surface for 2 mins. The dough will get stickier if you knead too long.. (For Avocado Naan, start with 3 cups of flour. If your avocado was not ripe or moist enough, you might need some water while kneading.).

itemListElement.text: Place the dough in the bowl. Drizzle a Tbsp of oil on the dough. Roll the dough to coat in oil. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or heavy kitchen towel and let sit to rise for 1.5 hours or until it doubles.
itemListElement.name: Place the dough in the bowl. Drizzle a Tbsp of oil on the dough. Roll the dough to coat in oil. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or heavy kitchen towel and let sit to rise for 1.5 hours or until it doubles.

itemListElement.text: Punch the dough down and use a Tbsp or more flour if needed to work for half a minute. Divide the dough into 8 pieces. Roll the dough balls lightly in flour and place on parchment. Cover with towel or another parchment and let sit for 20 to 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Punch the dough down and use a Tbsp or more flour if needed to work for half a minute. Divide the dough into 8 pieces. Roll the dough balls lightly in flour and place on parchment. Cover with towel or another parchment and let sit for 20 to 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Take each piece of dough, and roll/shape into 8 to 9 inch oval shape. roll and handle lightly to keep the dough airy. Dust lightly with flour to help with the rolling.
itemListElement.name: Take each piece of dough, and roll/shape into 8 to 9 inch oval shape. roll and handle lightly to keep the dough airy. Dust lightly with flour to help with the rolling.

itemListElement.text: Spritz the top of the Naan with water. Sprinkle Nigella seeds. Then brush or spray oil.
itemListElement.name: Spritz the top of the Naan with water. Sprinkle Nigella seeds. Then brush or spray oil.

itemListElement.text: Pre-heat the oven to 450 degrees F. Place a pizza stone in the oven and let heat for half an hour.
itemListElement.name: Pre-heat the oven to 450 degrees F. Place a pizza stone in the oven and let heat for half an hour.

itemListElement.text: Place as many breads as the stone can accommodate. Bake 2-3 minutes till the breads puffs and top gets golden. Broil for half a minute to crisp/char.
itemListElement.name: Place as many breads as the stone can accommodate. Bake 2-3 minutes till the breads puffs and top gets golden. Broil for half a minute to crisp/char.

itemListElement.text: Use any cast iron girdle/skillet/grill pan, which can withstand high heat. Heat it on medium high until heated evenly.
itemListElement.name: Use any cast iron girdle/skillet/grill pan, which can withstand high heat. Heat it on medium high until heated evenly.

itemListElement.text: Place the naan with bottom on the pan.
itemListElement.name: Place the naan with bottom on the pan.

itemListElement.text: Cover with a lid (optional) and let cook on medium high till it starts to puff. 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook for another minute.
itemListElement.name: Cover with a lid (optional) and let cook on medium high till it starts to puff. 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook for another minute.

itemListElement.text: To get charred Naan, hold the Naan directly over the gas flame with tongs for a few seconds to cook and char some spots.
itemListElement.name: To get charred Naan, hold the Naan directly over the gas flame with tongs for a few seconds to cook and char some spots.

itemListElement.text: Serve hot, topped with vegan butter or canola oil, with any Indian curry, Daal and veggies. To store for a short time, wrap in a clean kitchen towel. To store for longer, cool completely and place in an airtight bag. Keep on the counter for upto 2 days and in the refrigerator for upto 7 days.

itemListElement.text: Spritz water on the rolled Naan. Press 2 tsp of finely chopped garlic and a Tbsp chopped cilantro on the top along with the nigella seeds. Spray oil on the garlic. Cook according to instructions.
